title: [Large-Scale] Information Literacy Education Program for Pre-Service Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and college-level information retrieval experience
context.additional_context: Credit-bearing course focusing on cultivating information analysis/evaluation skills required for scientific research and education for pre-service/professional teachers

learning_goals: They can systematically search scientific academic resources and evaluate their scholarly credibility.

Select three science-related information sources (academic papers, news articles, blogs, etc.), write a report analyzing their bias and reliability, and present five-minute arguments meeting four+ out of five analysis criteria (e.g., source transparency, data openness, expert verification) in the presentation.

Learners can apply information literacy (information collection, evaluation, and utilization) in science education settings to complete a lesson design project consisting of three stages (topic selection–data analysis–lesson design) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

resources: Access to Science Domain Academic Database

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
